reviews.review_msg: Really chill and helpful professor. He shares video lecture recordings, which is convenient. All his learning materials, including slides and labs, are solid. Only thing is there is less transparency about the marking rubric for exams, but lenient marking and opportunities for bonus marks more than make up for it.

Dr. Shi is patient, caring, and approachable. He offers in-person and remote options. Exams are straightforward, and understanding his slides and labs will prepare you well. His grading is extremely generous in my opinion, with lots of bonus marks added for each student for allowable typos and more bonus for submitting the exam early.

Haolun is a solid prof, he makes lectures accessible so you can view/review on your own time. It helps a lot because some days your sick and dont want to be behind or just learn better on your own. Very helpful in answering questions and overall really nice. He is very clear on what he teaches as well
Professor Cutie Patootie

David's an amazing teacher, I'm giving him a 4 because the course was poorly put together. In his defence he said that it was his first time ever teaching the class. At the end of the course I felt I didn't know much more about Data Science than when I started. If I took the course with David again he would put together a better course for sure.

Great Prof for sure. Lectures are clear and all you need to do is to do the weekly homework and you will definitely pass with a good grade.
Exams are pretty balanced and based on the topics covered. Instructions to study are clear.
Taking another class with him and he is great in this class as well.

Great professor, Just need to do the homework every week and you will get good results for the course. Exams are super clear on instructions.
Taking another course with him and he is great again.

Taking 260/261 with Dr. Stenning is very enjoyable. He drops your 2 lowest quizzes which is extremely helpful!!! His lecture is very intuitive. The lab session is an excellent exercise for you to apply your lecture learning. If you can understand every exercise on lecture slides and lab handout. It is a straightforward A range course.

Without any doubt, take any class with this prof and you will not regret. He is the best prof in SFU. He explains stuff in so much detail, he records lectures.Hope he never stops doing that. Moreover, if you have understood all concepts thoroughly(which you surely will) and practice what he gives you will definitely score A

David is a very great lecturer, explains concepts very well, very approachable and gives great feedback in office hours. Please ignore the bad review he has for making you write code on paper, every computational course has that and the amount of code you write on paper in this class is a fraction of paper code you write in other classes.

A very, very caring professor. He grades fairly and goes the extra (EXTRA) mile when you ask or email him a question- which was so very helpful. He genuinely cared about the class which made us genuinely care. His lectures for 285 can get a bit dry sometimes (as he speaks statistics for 2hrs) but his humour was elite.Take him if you get him.

Stat260 with him was great. It was honestly the perfect course. Effort will get you far. nd he is always available to help.

Stat285 with him wasnt great since we weren't given workable examples for many topics which made it hard to learn. However, it was his first time teaching the course & he was listening to suggestions on how to make it better

CS student here. He's a fair grader. Lectures can be more succinct than the recommended textbook, although I'd still go through it. Came to appreciate the weekly quizzes and req to handwrite code for the midterm/final (given reference sheets). His humor is underrated. 260 could be a learning curve, but he's around.

Was my first time doing any programming, but had no problems with the course. Lectures are well-taught, and you get lots of practice via in-class exercises and weekly lecture+lab quizzes; all were very helpful/valuable. Exams were very fair. He has a friendly, respectful attitude and genuinely cares about helping you learn/understand the material.

He is the best professor on campus (There really was a hidden gem in the university after all). 
I was very fortunate to have a highly knowledgeable and experienced professor for the course. 
I'm afraid the class is a bit over my head.
However, Weekly office hours helps a lot. 
Thank you for taking care of us. Hope everything goes well with you.

Very fair and accommodating in grading. The class was not very difficult but I'm in computer science so not sure how it would be for those in other majors. Lectures were informative but I found them to be a bit dry sometimes. Class was very well organized.

Dr. Stenning is a very caring, kind, respectful, knowledgeable, and professional professor. His course was extremely organized. He would record and upload everything. His explanation is very clear. He was always ready to answer questions beyond office hours. He is so far the best prof I have had at SFU.

David makes you write codes on papers with a pen for final! I have no idea why he came up with that idea. It is unnecessary and makes life more difficult. This is definitely one of the hardest courses in stat, so make your life easier and take this course with another professor!

Prof Stenning is a real gem. He explains materials very clearly and gives relevant examples. He also responds very quickly to his email. He is very fair and cares about his students (pushed back the start time of the lecture by 30 minutes so students on campus could get settled). He made learning about R so fun!

Attendance is mandatory for tutorials to do quizzes & problem sets. Lecture attendance is necessary since quiz questions come from the lecture exercises omitted from posted slides. Exams were super fair and reflected the lectures and problem sets. Cheat sheets are provided for the midterm and the final. He's an awesome guy and encourages questions.

Owen's class was the best coding class I have taken. The weekly quizzes are just the examples done in class so if you go to class, take notes on the examples you will be fine. Midterm was a breeze because he gave a practice package that was almost identical but final was a bit tricky. Just do the lab work and you'll be fine.

Solid lecturer, answers any and every question students may have. Although attendance is not mandatory, I recommend heavily you attend lectures. Overall, Owen Ward is solid professor for stats260. Good lectures, lectures are based on the book, and exams should not have any surprises if you did all the assigned practice questions.

The course is well structured and literally has practice questions and solutions for every quiz and assignment and practice exam. Practice exams prepare you well for the actual exam. Honestly a good professor!
